entry.title: AI and ICE: U.S. Immigration Scans Social Media Before Approving Visas
entry.summary: Artificial intelligence speeds the process of reviewing online posts by people seeking to enter the country, sparking debate over privacy.

entry.title: Google Doubles Down with $2 Billion Investment in Claude AI Developer Anthropic
entry.summary: Amid a high-stakes rivalry with Microsoft, Google is beating big on the OpenAI rival.

entry.title: Sam Bankman-Fried Says He Wanted to Sell FTX to Binance Since It Was Founded
entry.summary: The disgraced crypto founder testified that he built FTX to serve a niche that would make it an acquisition target of Binance.

entry.title: AI Girlfriend Amouranth Wants to Use Her 'Vaginal Yeast' to Brew Beer
entry.summary: From digital darling to brew enthusiast, Amouranth introduces a beer that's bound to raise eyebrows and glasses alike.

entry.title: Shutterstock Integrates AI Into Its Library of 700 Million Images
entry.summary: Shutterstock joins Getty Images and Canva in introducing creator-friendly AI art generators.

entry.title: Chainlink Jumps 6% While Bitcoin and Ethereum Hold Steady
entry.summary: The main cause of Bitcoin’s soaring price: Mounting hype and certainty among investors that the SEC will soon approve a spot Bitcoin ETF.

entry.title: This Week in Coins: Chainlink Moons 44%, Leads Marketwide ETF Speculation Rally
entry.summary: Bitcoin and other leading coins have now been rallying for a fortnight.

entry.title: Gemini Sues Genesis for Control of $1.6 Billion in Grayscale Bitcoin Trust Shares
entry.summary: The Genesis-Gemini saga continues, with a new twist.

entry.title: Kraken Warns Users: Your Bitcoin Trading Data Is Headed to the IRS
entry.summary: Kraken sent an email to customers on Wednesday to let them know it plans to share data on crypto trades of more than $20,000 by November.

entry.title: What Is Lido Finance, Ethereum's Largest Liquid Staking Project?
entry.summary: Lido Finance has long held the lion’s share of the liquid staking market on Ethereum, but what is it and how does it work?

entry.title: SBF Trial Live Updates: Sam Bankman-Fried Wanted to Sell FTX
entry.summary: FTX founder Sam Bankman-Fried faces seven criminal charges related to the dramatic collapse of his crypto empire. Here's the latest on his trial.

entry.title: New dYdX Chain Denominates Trading Fees in USDC
entry.summary: Stakers and validators will also earn all of the newly launched chain's fees for helping to secure the dYdX Chain.

entry.title: Crypto ‘Not the Vast Majority’ of Terrorism Funding, Says US Treasury Deputy Secretary
entry.summary: Bitcoin is just a natural next step to fund illicit activities, coming after PayPal and the traditional banking system.

entry.title: LayerZero Hit With Hefty Backlash After ‘Frontrunning’ Lido Governance
entry.summary: LayerZero announced a new integration to the rejoice of three different blockchains and the chagrin of one DeFi project in particular.

entry.title: AI Must Be 'Harnessed Responsibly' to Curtail Doomsday Scenarios, Says UN Secretary-General
entry.summary: While AI may offer key opportunities, the UN is concerned that just "a handful of companies and countries" will have expertise with the tech.

entry.title: Invisible Ink: Researchers Probe the Weaknesses of Watermarking AI-Generated Content
entry.summary: New research suggests watermarking may not be enough to ensure that we can identify deepfakes.

entry.title: The Inside of Mars Is ‘Surprisingly Soft’, A New Survey Says
entry.summary: NASA's InSight rover has been collecting seismic data on Mars for three years, offering a snapshot of the planet's internal structure.

entry.title: Sam Bankman-Fried Testifies During Special Hearing—After The Jury Is Sent Home
entry.summary: The former CEO of the failed FTX exchange took the stand for an audience of one, so Judge Lewis Kaplan could vet the admissibility of his statements.

entry.title: A Bitcoin ETF Could Soon Finally Launch. What If It Flops?
entry.summary: Bitcoin hopefuls are crossing their fingers for the approval of a spot crypto ETF. But will demand match the hype?

entry.title: Ryder Ripps Must Pay Yuga Labs $1.5 Million for Bored Ape Trademark Infringement
entry.summary: A U.S. District Judge orders Ryder Ripps and Jeremy Cahen to cease all NFT sales and relinquish its blockchain assets.

entry.title: Bitcoin Senator Urges ‘Swift Action’ Against Binance, Tether for Links to Terrorist Groups
entry.summary: The bipartisan letter comes after lawmakers flagged the use of crypto in terrorism to the Biden Administration.

entry.title: Future Fashion Summit Connects Luxury Houses, Digital Platforms in Paris
entry.summary: “There’s definitely a shift happening from mobile devices to wearables,” said Snapchat’s global head of luxury.

entry.title: Blockchain Will Be ‘Standard’ for Gaming in Asia: Bandai Namco Exec
entry.summary: In Asia, says the game publisher's SVP of corporate development, Web3 doesn't have the that stigma it does in the West.

entry.title: God Mode: 7 Twisted 'Thomas the Tank Engine' Game Mods—From Starfield to Skyrim
entry.summary: Thomas the Tank Engine isn't in Grand Theft Auto V, Elden Ring, or Starfield—unless you want him to be. Check out these must-play mods.

entry.title: New UK Bill Strengthens Authorities Ability to Seize Illicit Crypto
entry.summary: The bill's passing means police will have a more leeway when it comes to seizing cryptocurrencies involved in crimes.

entry.title: More Tokens Than Ever Are Being Staked, Says New Research
entry.summary: Aptos and SUI were the most staked networks by the percentage of circulating supply that had been locked in, new research revealed.

entry.title: Trezor Safe 3 Review: A Hardware Wallet for Bitcoin Newcomers
entry.summary: The latest addition to Trezor’s lineup is aimed at “new entrants to crypto.” Does it make getting started simple?

entry.title: Memecoin Madness: PEPE, Dogecoin and SHIB Surge Amid Crypto Rally
entry.summary: The memecoins haven't been forgotten in the latest rally, with PEPE, DOGE, and SHIB all soaring double-digits over the week.

entry.title: AI-Generated Child Abuse Material Could ‘Overwhelm’ the Internet, UK Group Warns
entry.summary: The Internet Watch Foundation says over 20,000 AI-generated images were found on a single darkweb forum in just one month.

entry.title: Amazon Takes on AI Rivals With Child-Friendly Alexa Features
entry.summary: Amazon's Alexa now offers Explore with Alexa, a feature that gives kids personalized and trusted educational responses.

entry.title: ‘I’m Finally Getting Some Opposition On My Bitcoin Bill', Says Mexican Senator
entry.summary: Indira Kempis has been leading the legislative conversation towards establishing Bitcoin as legal tender in Mexico.

entry.title: Tech Titans Microsoft and Google Make AI Moves Down Under
entry.summary: While the appeal of a largely untapped market is clear, some say the move could also reflect a regulatory chill in the U.S.

entry.title: Are You Playing Starfield? Over 11 Million Gamers Are, Says Microsoft CEO
entry.summary: The first new universe for Bethesda in 25 years was the top-selling video game last month.

entry.title: Stocks Are Down, Bitcoin Is Way Up—Will This Time Be Different?
entry.summary: Bitcoin ETF hype can explain a lot about why BTC appears to have decoupled from stocks. But analysts say that's not the only reason.

entry.title: FTX Selling the Pump? Estate Moves $8.6M Ethereum, Chainlink, Aave and Maker to Binance
entry.summary: The funds are on the move again—this time to the collapsed exchange’s rival

entry.title: Amanda Cassatt on Web3 Marketing and the early days of Ethereum
entry.summary:
In this week's episode, our host is joined by Amanda Cassatt!
Amanda is the founder of Serotonin, a web3 marketing agency, the author of the first book ever published on web3 marketing, and led the marketing team that helped bring Ethereum to market.

entry.title: Bitcoin Hits $35,000, Reaching 16-Month High Amid ETF Hype
entry.summary: Bitcoin continues its climb amid speculation of an imminent ETF approval, this time breaching a key milestone not seen since May 2022.

entry.title: 'Parallel' Game Adds Over 120 New NFT Cards in Planetfall Expansion
entry.summary: Parallel is releasing new cards for its game via blind bundles. While little is known about the cards so far, some new art has been revealed.

entry.title: Midnight Society's Rob Bowling on Deadrop's New Cars and User-Generated Modes
entry.summary: Decrypt reporter and GG producer Kate Irwin interviews Midnight Society Studio Head Rob Bowling about Deadrop's development and Snapshot VII.

entry.title: Game Review: 'Raini: The Lords of Light' Brands Itself With Memes
entry.summary: Raini: Lords of Light is an NFT-optional card game bursting with crypto memes. From SBF to CZ and Elon, this free-to-play game has some truly wild animations. Decrypt contributor Ryan S. Gladwin shares his honest thoughts on the game.

entry.title: Art Blocks Marfa Weekend Recap
entry.summary: Relive the Art Blocks Marfa Weekend 2023 event with this highlights video, produced by Vincent Roazzi Jr. for Decrypt Studios in partnership with Art Blocks.

entry.title: Phantom Galaxies: A Look Inside the Mech Shooter NFT Game
entry.summary: Animoca Brands and game studio Blowfish are developing Phantom Galaxies, an upcoming sci-fi mech shooter game inspired by mech battlers like Transformers. Decrypt's Kate Irwin asks Blowfish Studios Cofounder and Managing Director Ben Lee about what it's like to play the game.

entry.title: Clip: DeepMedia's DeepID Deepfake Detection Tool at Work
entry.summary: A clip showcasing how DeepMedia's DeepID deepfake detection tool works. Courtesy: DeepMedia

entry.title: Decentraland AI World Fair Trailer
entry.summary: A trailer for the AI World Fair event in metaverse game Decentraland, taking place from October 25-27. Courtesy: Decentraland.

entry.title: BackTheBunny - Money, Conspiracy, Milady
entry.summary:
Our host Reza Jafery sits down with BackTheBunny to dive deep into money, the fight against crypto that we're witnessing in real-time, and milady culture.
Our Host: https://twitter.com/rezajafery Our Guest: https://twitter.com/BackTheBunny
Our Sponsors https://decrypt.co/1000x

entry.title: 'A Grand Experiment': Shrapnel Studio Head Don Norbury Talks Game Economics
entry.summary: How much of Shrapnel's in-game items are tradeable NFTs? Don Norbury, Studio Head at Shrapnel and CTO at game studio NEON, tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about Shrapnel's approach to game economics, including different game pricing models and how NFT game economies create different challenges for developers.

entry.title: Trezor Safe 3 and Trezor Keep Metal Unboxing
entry.summary: Trezor has launched the Safe 3, a hardware wallet aimed at "new entrants to crypto," alongside the new Keep Metal recovery seed storage device. We take a first look at what comes in the box.

entry.title: Why AI Arena is Building on Arbitrum
entry.summary: AI Arena CEO Brandon Da Silva and COO Wei Xie discuss the challenges that come with building on Ethereum, ETH sidechains, and layer-two blockchains.

entry.title: Pet3rPan_ on venture DAOs and blockchain games
entry.summary:
Welcome to the 4th episode of this time will be different.
Our guest for today's episode is Pet3rpan_ from Metacartel, 1kx, HydraVentures, and more!
https://twitter.com/pet3rpan_
This Time Will Be Different is sponsored by 1000x https://decrypt.co/1000x

entry.title: Inside Shrapnel's Marketplace, New Map, and 'AI Director' Feature
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin chats with Shrapnel's Head of Studio Don Norbury to get the latest updates on how the NFT-powered first-person sci-fi extraction shooter's development is progressing.

entry.title: 'Art of the Times': Art Blocks Founder Erick Calderon on the State of Generative Art
entry.summary: Art Blocks founder and CEO Erick Calderon sat down with Sander Lutz, lead culture reporter at Decrypt's SCENE, at Art Blocks Marfa Weekend 2023. They discuss the evolution of the company and the generative art world, along with what draws art enthusiasts to be an active part of the community.

entry.title: Decrypt Learn: Digital Ownership Explained
entry.summary: One of the most powerful aspects of blockchain technology is its ability to provide us genuine ownership of our digital assets. This is called digital ownership. In this video, we’ll deep dive into digital ownership, why it matters, and how web3 makes owning digital assets like our social networks, music libraries, personal data, and beyond possible. Author: Clarissa Watson, Senior Writer at Consensys.

entry.title: Martin Shkreli on E/ACC and SBF in Prison
entry.summary: Reza Jafery and Martin Shkreli sit down for a casual conversation about the growing movement that is E/ACC, what songs they could recite at gunpoint, and whether or not SBF will thrive or just survive during his time in prison.

entry.title: What Can AI Do in Gaming?
entry.summary: AI Arena CEO Brandon Da Silva and COO Wei Xie discuss how artificial intelligence can shape the video game experience.

entry.title: 'There Are No Real Standards': Ready Player Me CEO Timmu Tõke on Building for an Open Gaming Ecosystem
entry.summary: Timmu Tõke, co-founder and CEO of Ready Player Me, joins Decrypt contributor Ryan Gladwin to discuss the startup's approach to powering avatars that are interoperable across games and metaverse platforms—and what's needed to convince the industry to adopt standards and open up.

entry.title: Blockchain Is 'Only Way' Forward for Gaming, Says Shrapnel Studio Head
entry.summary: Shrapnel Studio Head Don Norbury tells Kate Irwin the reasons why the upcoming first-person shooter game will offer a wide range of NFTs. He also reveals team-based gameplay plans and shares how game maps have already changed this year.
